page.title: 15RUDGWICK-EMPLOYMENT PATTERNS
page.content:
Despite Rudgwick's predominantly{RURAL {ENVIRONMENT,}a{SURVEY}of{PARENTS}with children at{RUDGWICK SCHOOL}indicated} few people were engaged in work that could be{CLASSIFIED}as{PRIMARY}i.e. _ {AGRICULTURE.}Similarly,few people were employed in{MANUFACTURING}or{SECONDARY {OCCUPATIONS.}Within the{TERTIARY CATE- {GORY,}however,{3}main sub-groups could be{IDENTIFIED}ranging from{SKILLED}and {PROFESSIONAL}employees{(47%)}to{SEMI- {SKILLED}workers{(32%)}and{NON-SKILLED {(21%).}The types of employment were varied but included -{PILOT,SOLICITOR, {AR
25km}away.Transport used includes{MOTORCARS}and{RAILWAYS.
